block.p: The Pacific Gas and Electric Company priced $200 million in first and refunding mortgage bonds yesterday through competitive bidding won by a group of underwriters led by the First Boston Corporation. Rated A-1 by Moody's and A by Standard & Poor's, the bonds due in 2024 have an 8 7/8 percent coupon and are priced at 95.50, to yield 9.314 percent. Proceeds from the sale will be used for general corporate purposes, including the redemption on June 1 of about $119 million in series 86A bonds.

The Pacific Gas and Electric Company priced $200 million in first and refunding mortgage bonds yesterday through competitive bidding won by a group of underwriters led by the First Boston Corporation. Rated A-1 by Moody's and A by Standard & Poor's, the bonds due in 2024 have an 8 7/8 percent coupon and are priced at 95.50, to yield 9.314 percent. Proceeds from the sale will be used for general corporate purposes, including the redemption on June 1 of about $119 million in series 86A bonds.
